user.title: Smarter Heat Pump Setup
user.description: Configure your Smarter Heat Pump integration. You must provide either a weather entity OR an outside temperature sensor.

data_description.name: Name for this heat pump integration
data_description.room_temp_sensor: Temperature sensor in the room where the heat pump is located
data_description.weather_entity: Weather entity for outside temperature data
data_description.outside_temp_sensor: Alternative to weather entity - direct outside temperature sensor
data_description.climate_entity: Existing climate entity to integrate with (optional)
data_description.remote_entity: IR remote entity (e.g., Broadlink remote) for sending commands
data_description.actuator_switch: Physical switch entity to control the heat pump
data_description.virtual_switch: If enabled (or no actuator switch provided), creates a virtual switch entity for manual control
data_description.schedule_entity: Schedule helper to enable scheduled temperature control

commands.title: IR Commands Configuration
commands.description: Configure the IR command names for your heat pump. These will be sent via the remote entity.

data_description.remote_device: Device ID for Broadlink remotes (leave empty for other remote types)
data_description.power_on_command: Command name to turn the heat pump on
data_description.power_off_command: Command name to turn the heat pump off
data_description.temp_up_command: Command name to increase temperature by 1°C
data_description.temp_down_command: Command name to decrease temperature by 1°C

settings.title: Heat Pump Settings
settings.description: Configure heat pump behavior and power estimation

data_description.min_cycle_duration: Minimum time the heat pump must stay on/off before switching state (prevents rapid cycling)
data_description.heat_tolerance: Temperature tolerance above target before turning off
data_description.cold_tolerance: Temperature tolerance below target before turning on
data_description.min_power_consumption: Base power consumption when heat pump is running (watts)
data_description.cop_value: Coefficient of Performance - efficiency rating (typically 2-4 for heat pumps)

schedule.title: Smart Schedule
schedule.description: Enable intelligent scheduling with custom logic

schedule_template.title: Schedule Template
schedule_template.description:
Configure your custom schedule logic using Jinja templates

{template_help}

schedule_attributes.title: Schedule Attributes
schedule_attributes.description:
Configure template variables for your schedule

{attributes_help}

error.invalid_entity: The specified entity does not exist
error.missing_outside_temp: Either weather entity or outside temperature sensor must be provided
